text:
Been eating here for over 20 years. Food has remained consistently good. We always order the mutton curry, sotong curry and tandoori chicken. The yellow rice and 2 side veggies, always delicious as well. Free flow poppadoms are light, crispy and yummy.
Service is quite efficient but can be challenging when the restaurant is full.

Karu's Indian Banana Leaf Restaurant is a gem along Upper Bukit Timah! I'm a huge fan of their fish head curry, but today's try of their butter chicken and mutton biryani was great! Both dishes were delicious, but the butter chicken stole the show - it's hands down the best I've ever tasted! Rich, creamy, and full of flavour.

Long time never come.  Food still great. Another great place to enjoy some Indian food. Even seem a birthday celebration here. So nice.

Staffs are friendly and nice. But tends to cluster in a group at the counter. But will come immediately when call.

:)

Car Parking wise have to innovate.

Fish head curry lacked depth of flavour and felt rather flat. Mutton was also so-so and nothing to shout about. For all papadum lovers, it is free flow. Parking is quite limited and can be a hassle to find.

Food was decent, however the restaurant wasn't very hygienic. All 4 of us felt queasy after lunch.

Tables, chairs and floor were greasy and waiters wore the same gloves when handling food and clearing tables.

Parking was a major problem at the Upper Bukit Timah branch. Very limited parking available at the next building.

While the food was decent, I probably will NOT be back for a while until they "clean up" their act.
